doc.name: beepSound
doc.summary: Specifies the method used to produce sound when the beep command is used.

description.overview: Use the beepSound property to change the sound made when the beep command is used.

parameter.name: beepType
parameter.description: A string containing one of the following:

option.description: The system standard alert sound is played.
The computer's motherboard speaker is used (if present).
The device vibrates rather than play a sound (iOS only).

description.value:
The beepSound property is one of the following:
* system - this performs beep on mobile devices
* internal
* vibrate
* empty
description.comments:
When the beep command is executed, LiveCode makes a sound using the method specified by the beepSound property.
Setting the beepSound property only has an effect on the Windows desktop platform. On other desktop platforms the "system" method is used regardless of its setting.
The iPhone does not have a default system alert sound so if a sounds is required one must be specified by using the beepSound property.
If you use beep with beepSound set to "internal" be sure to test your program on the machines you will be running it on. Some Windows machines have faulty drivers for the motherboard speaker which can cause applications using it to crash.
